title: 4 crude bombs explode in Dhaka
body: Four crude bombs exploded in different parts of Dhaka today, leaving one person injured, police said. The lone injury occurred when a crude bomb exploded in front of Muktijoddha Super Market in Dhaka's Mirpur-1 around 4:30pm, Jahangir Alam, officer-in-charge of Shah Ali Police Station, told The Daily Star. Assistant Commissioner of Police (Darussalam zone) Emdad Hossain said the victim sustained minor injuries. Police primarily suspect that the bomb was thrown from the third floor of the market. A trader at the market said miscreants hurled the crude bomb from one of the market's floors. Besides this incident, at least three other crude bombs exploded at different locations in Dhaka within the span of about an hour this evening. According to the DMP Traffic Alert Group, an explosion occurred around 8:15pm close to Shantinagar west signal, where a crude bomb hit an advertising billboard beside a banyan tree and exploded. Around 8:25pm, another crude bomb went off at the northern signal near Mirpur-10 police box. Police said no one was injured. The next explosion took place at Mouchak Crossing around 8:40pm. Police confirmed that no casualties were reported there either. Contacted, DMP Deputy Commissioner Masud Alam told The Daily Star that police teams rushed to the spots immediately after the explosions.
